hints.content: Start by understanding the problem statement clearly. You need to find the maximum distance between two houses with different colors. Remember that the distance is calculated using the absolute difference of their indices.
Consider how you can identify the first and last occurrences of different colors in the array. This will help you determine the maximum distance without needing to check every pair of houses.

Think about the properties of the array. The maximum distance will likely involve the first house of one color and the last house of another color. Can you identify the first and last indices of the colors?

You can iterate through the array to find the first and last indices of the first and last colors. For example, if the first house has color 'A', find the last index of any house with a different color.
Consider edge cases where the colors might be the same for most houses except for the first and last. How would that affect your calculations? Make sure to handle these scenarios correctly.
You can optimize your approach by only considering the first and last indices of the two different colors. This reduces the number of comparisons you need to make.
Once you have the first and last indices of the two different colors, calculate the distances. Remember to check both combinations: first of one color to last of another, and vice versa.
Make sure to use the absolute value function to ensure the distance is always positive. This is crucial since the distance is defined as abs(i - j).
Your final step is to return the maximum of the two distances you calculated. Think about how you can structure this part of your code efficiently.
As a final tip, remember that the input constraints guarantee at least two houses of different colors. This means you do not need to handle cases where all houses are the same color.

questionNotes: The input is a 0-indexed integer array of colors.
You must return the maximum distance between two houses with different colors.
Distance is defined as abs(i - j).
There are guaranteed to be at least two houses with different colors.
